segment.source: Sysprep Command-Line Options
segment.target: Sysprep Command-Line Options

segment.source: Sysprep Command-Line Options
segment.target: Sysprep Command-Line Options

segment.source: Sysprep Command-Line Options
segment.target: Sysprep Command-Line Options

segment.source: Run Sysprep to prepare a Windows installation to be captured.
segment.target: Run Sysprep to prepare a Windows installation to be captured.

segment.source: This topic describes the command-line syntax for the System Preparation (Sysprep) tool.
segment.target: This topic describes the command-line syntax for the System Preparation (Sysprep) tool.

segment.source: If you intend to create an image of an installation for deployment to a different computer, you must run the Sysprep command together with the /generalize option, even if the other computer has the same hardware configuration.
segment.target: If you intend to create an image of an installation for deployment to a different computer, you must run the Sysprep command together with the /generalize option, even if the other computer has the same hardware configuration.

segment.source: The Sysprep /generalize command removes unique information from your Windows installation so that you can safely reuse that image on a different computer.
segment.target: The Sysprep /generalize command removes unique information from your Windows installation so that you can safely reuse that image on a different computer.

segment.source: The next time that you boot the Windows image, the specialize configuration pass runs.
segment.target: The next time that you boot the Windows image, the specialize configuration pass runs.

segment.source: Sysprep Command-Line Options
segment.target: Sysprep Command-Line Options

segment.source: The following command-line options are available for Sysprep:
segment.target: The following command-line options are available for Sysprep:

segment.source: /generalize
segment.target: /generalize

segment.source: /mode:vm
segment.target: /mode:vm

segment.source: /quiet
segment.target: /quiet

segment.source: The following table lists Sysprep command-line options:
segment.target: The following table lists Sysprep command-line options:

segment.source: Option
segment.target: Option

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: /audit
segment.target: /audit

segment.source: Restarts the computer into audit mode.
segment.target: Restarts the computer into audit mode.

segment.source: Audit mode enables you to add additional drivers or applications to Windows.
segment.target: Audit mode enables you to add additional drivers or applications to Windows.

segment.source: You can also test an installation of Windows before you send the installation to an end user.
segment.target: You can also test an installation of Windows before you send the installation to an end user.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: If you specify an answer file, the audit mode of Windows Setup runs the auditSystem and auditUser configuration passes.
segment.target: If you specify an answer file, the audit mode of Windows Setup runs the auditSystem and auditUser configuration passes.

segment.source: /generalize
segment.target: /generalize

segment.source: Prepares the Windows installation to be imaged.
segment.target: Prepares the Windows installation to be imaged.

segment.source: Sysprep removes all unique system information from the Windows installation.
segment.target: Sysprep removes all unique system information from the Windows installation.

segment.source: Sysprep resets the security ID (SID), clears any system restore points, and deletes event logs.
segment.target: Sysprep resets the security ID (SID), clears any system restore points, and deletes event logs.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: The next time that the computer starts, the specialize configuration pass runs.
segment.target: The next time that the computer starts, the specialize configuration pass runs.

segment.source: The configuration pass creates a new security ID (SID).
segment.target: The configuration pass creates a new security ID (SID).

segment.source: /oobe
segment.target: /oobe

segment.source: Restarts the computer into OOBE mode.
segment.target: Restarts the computer into OOBE mode.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: OOBE enables end users to customize their Windows operating system, create user accounts, name the computer, and perform other tasks.
segment.target: OOBE enables end users to customize their Windows operating system, create user accounts, name the computer, and perform other tasks.

segment.source: Sysprep processes any settings in the oobeSystem configuration pass in an answer file before OOBE starts.
segment.target: Sysprep processes any settings in the oobeSystem configuration pass in an answer file before OOBE starts.

segment.source: /mode:vm
segment.target: /mode:vm

segment.source: Generalizes a Virtual Hard Disk (VHD) so that you can deploy the VHD as a VHD on the same Virtual Machine (VM) or hypervisor.
segment.target: Generalizes a Virtual Hard Disk (VHD) so that you can deploy the VHD as a VHD on the same Virtual Machine (VM) or hypervisor.

segment.source: After the VM restarts, the VM can boot to OOBE.
segment.target: After the VM restarts, the VM can boot to OOBE.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: The only additional switches that apply to VM mode are /reboot, /shutdown, and /quit.You must deploy the VHD on a Virtual Machine (VM) or hypervisor with the same hardware profile.
segment.target: The only additional switches that apply to VM mode are /reboot, /shutdown, and /quit.You must deploy the VHD on a Virtual Machine (VM) or hypervisor with the same hardware profile.

segment.source: For example, if you created VHD in Microsoft Hyper-V, you can only deploy your VHD to Microsoft Hyper-V VMs with a matching hardware profile.
segment.target: For example, if you created VHD in Microsoft Hyper-V, you can only deploy your VHD to Microsoft Hyper-V VMs with a matching hardware profile.

segment.source: Deploying the VHD to a different VM with a different hardware profile might cause unexpected issues.
segment.target: Deploying the VHD to a different VM with a different hardware profile might cause unexpected issues.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: You can only run VM mode from inside a VM.
segment.target: You can only run VM mode from inside a VM.

segment.source: /reboot
segment.target: /reboot

segment.source: Restarts the computer.
segment.target: Restarts the computer.

segment.source: You can use this option to audit the computer and to verify that the first-run experience operates correctly.
segment.target: You can use this option to audit the computer and to verify that the first-run experience operates correctly.

segment.source: /shutdown
segment.target: /shutdown

segment.source: Shuts down the computer after the Sysprep command finishes running.
segment.target: Shuts down the computer after the Sysprep command finishes running.

segment.source: /quiet
segment.target: /quiet

segment.source: Runs the Sysprep tool without displaying on-screen confirmation messages.
segment.target: Runs the Sysprep tool without displaying on-screen confirmation messages.

segment.source: You can use this option if you automate the Sysprep tool.
segment.target: You can use this option if you automate the Sysprep tool.

segment.source: /quit
segment.target: /quit

segment.source: Closes the Sysprep tool without rebooting or shutting down the computer after Sysprep runs the specified commands.
segment.target: Closes the Sysprep tool without rebooting or shutting down the computer after Sysprep runs the specified commands.

segment.source: /unattend:answerfile
segment.target: /unattend:answerfile

segment.source: Applies settings in an answer file to Windows during an unattended installation, where answerfile specifies the path and file name of the answer file to use.
segment.target: Applies settings in an answer file to Windows during an unattended installation, where answerfile specifies the path and file name of the answer file to use.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: where F is the drive letter of the portable storage device on which the answer file (Unattend.xml) is located.
segment.target: where F is the drive letter of the portable storage device on which the answer file (Unattend.xml) is located.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: You must use the Sysprep /generalize command to generalize a complete Windows installation before you can use the installation for deployment to a new computer, whether you use imaging, hard disk duplication, or another method.
segment.target: You must use the Sysprep /generalize command to generalize a complete Windows installation before you can use the installation for deployment to a new computer, whether you use imaging, hard disk duplication, or another method.

segment.source: Moving or copying a Windows image to a different computer without running the Sysprep /generalize command is not supported.
segment.target: Moving or copying a Windows image to a different computer without running the Sysprep /generalize command is not supported.
